devGuide.title: Developer Guide
devGuide.subtitle: Comprehensive guide for developers working on Learnova Academy

meta.title: Developer Guide - Learnova Academy
meta.description: Comprehensive development guide for Learnova Academy learning platform

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.description: Learnova Academy is a comprehensive bilingual learning platform built with Nuxt 4, Vue 3, and TypeScript. It supports multiple programming courses with full internationalization and progress tracking.

features.bilingual: Full bilingual support (English/Arabic) with RTL layout
features.progress: Comprehensive progress tracking and user analytics
features.responsive: Mobile-first responsive design with Nuxt UI components
features.ssr: Server-side rendering with static generation support

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.description: Understanding the core architecture patterns and design decisions behind Learnova Academy.
architecture.multiCourseDesc: The platform uses a centralized course registry with individual course management, allowing multiple courses to coexist with shared infrastructure.
architecture.courseFlow:
Course Registry â†’ Content Structure â†’ Progress Tracking
â”œâ”€â”€ config/courses.ts (Course definitions)
â”œâ”€â”€ content/courses/[courseId]/ (Course content)
â””â”€â”€ composables/ (Business logic)
architecture.dataFlowExample: Example: useCourseRegistry() loads course config, useCourses() fetches content, useCourseProgress() tracks completion status.

courseManagement.title: Course Management
courseManagement.description: Learn how to create, manage, and structure courses in the Learnova Academy platform.
courseManagement.registryDescription: All courses are defined in the centralized course registry located at config/courses.ts

components.title: Component Library
components.description: Comprehensive overview of the component architecture used throughout Learnova Academy.

courseCard.description: Display course information with progress indicators and clickable navigation.

navigation.description: Complete course navigation system with breadcrumbs and progress tracking.

moduleNav.description: Interactive module and lesson navigation with collapsible sections.

lessonRenderer.description: Render lesson content with course context and progress integration.

components.nuxtUIDesc: We use Nuxt UI components as our primary design system. Always prefer these over custom implementations.
components.nuxtUIComponents: Primary Nuxt UI components: UContainer, UCard, UButton, UInput, USelect, UProgress, UBadge, UIcon, UModal, UDropdown, UTooltip, UAlert. Always prefer these over custom implementations.

i18n.title: Internationalization
i18n.description: Complete guide to the internationalization system supporting English and Arabic with RTL layout.
i18n.setupDesc: The platform uses Nuxt i18n module for comprehensive internationalization support with cookie-based language persistence.
i18n.basicUsage: Use the i18n composable and localePath for navigation. In templates use translation keys for all text content.

practices.keys: Always use translation keys - never hardcode text
practices.navigation: Use localePath() for all navigation links
practices.rtl: Test all components in both LTR and RTL modes

i18n.rtlDesc: The platform fully supports RTL (Right-to-Left) layout for Arabic. Use logical CSS properties for proper RTL behavior.
i18n.rtlExample: Use CSS logical properties for RTL support: padding-inline instead of padding-left/right, margin-inline-start instead of margin-left, text-align: start instead of text-align: left.
i18n.addingDesc: To add support for a new language, follow these steps:

steps.createFile: Create a new locale file in i18n/locales/[lang].json
steps.updateConfig: Update nuxt.config.ts to include the new locale
steps.addContent: Add translated content for all existing keys
steps.testRTL: Test RTL support if the language requires it

progressSystem.title: Progress System
progressSystem.description: Comprehensive progress tracking system that monitors user learning across courses, modules, and lessons.
progressSystem.architectureDesc: The progress system operates at three levels: lesson, module, and course, with persistent local storage.
progressSystem.persistenceDesc: Progress data is stored in localStorage with automatic synchronization across browser sessions.
progressSystem.debuggingDesc: Use browser developer tools to inspect and debug progress data.
progressSystem.debugCommands: Use browser console to debug progress: check localStorage, inspect progress object, verify course IDs.

workflow.title: Development Workflow
workflow.description: Recommended development practices, git workflow, and deployment procedures for Learnova Academy.
workflow.gitDesc: We follow a feature-branch workflow with pull requests for all changes.
workflow.gitCommands: Standard git workflow: create feature branch, add changes, commit with descriptive message, push to origin, create pull request, review and merge to main.
workflow.codeReviewDesc: Every pull request should be reviewed for these key areas:

review.i18n: i18n compliance - all text uses translation keys
review.responsive: Responsive design - works on mobile and desktop

workflow.deploymentDesc: The platform is deployed to Vercel with automatic deployments from the main branch.
workflow.deploymentSteps: Deployment checklist: 1. Run full test suite 2. Type check 3. Build check 4. Validate courses 5. Merge to main branch 6. Vercel auto-deploys from main

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common issues and their solutions when developing with Learnova Academy.

i18nError.title: i18n Linked Format Error
i18nError.description: Error when special symbols appear in translation text, causing linked format parsing issues.
i18nError.solution: Replace problematic symbols in translations. Instead of using special characters, use descriptive text. For example, use 'Nuxt UI components' instead of component package names.

buildError.title: Build Cache Issues
buildError.description: Stale cache causing build failures or unexpected behavior during development.
buildError.solution: Clear all caches and restart development server. Remove .nuxt directory, clear node_modules cache, then restart with npm run dev.

progressLost.title: Progress Data Lost
progressLost.description: User progress not persisting or being lost between sessions.
progressLost.solution: Check localStorage in browser, verify progress composable usage, ensure courseId, moduleId, lessonId are correct.

performance.title: Slow Page Loading
performance.description: Pages loading slowly, especially course content pages with large amounts of data.
performance.solution: Use lazy loading for heavy components and optimize content queries. Check bundle size and implement performance optimizations.

troubleshooting.debuggingDesc: Essential debugging tools and techniques for Learnova Academy development.
troubleshooting.debuggingTools: Use Vue DevTools to inspect component state, Browser DevTools to check localStorage, Nuxt DevTools for performance analysis, and TypeScript compiler to catch type errors.

comingSoon.title: Section Coming Soon
comingSoon.description: This section is currently being developed. Check back later for comprehensive documentation.
